meanings: (말·힘·무기 등으로) fight, do battle (with), (말다툼하다) argue, quarrel, (전쟁을 하다) be at a war (with)

phrases.phrase: 서울 가 본 놈하고 안 가 본 놈하고 싸우면 서울 가 본 놈이 못 이긴다
meanings: When there is a fight between a person who has been to Seoul and a person who has never been to Seoul, the latter wins

meanings.meaning: If you fight, you will hurt each other.

examples.korean: If you fight, you will hurt each other. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 싸우면 서로 상처를 준다. (서양속담, 원수속담) 명언/속담

examples.korean: If the two are struggling again, then knock their heads together. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 두 사람이 또다시 싸우면 그들을 강경한 수단으로 말려라. YBM All in All English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: If the two are struggling again, then knock their heads together. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: One day, as he looked for a bit of rice to fill his empty stomach, Sher came upon two dogs fighting over a scrap of meat. 'Fighting will get you nothing except sores and scars,' said Sher. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 하루는 소년이 주린 배를 채우려고 쌀을 조금 찾고 있었다. Sher는 고기 한점 때문에 싸우는 개 두마리에게 다가갔다.'싸우면 남는 건 상처와 쓰라림 뿐이야'라고 sher는 말했다. Neungyule
examples.english: One day, as he looked for a bit of rice to fill his empty stomach, Sher came upon two dogs fighting over a scrap of meat. 'Fighting will get you nothing except sores and scars,' said Sher. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: And when I have a fight with my younger brother, my mom is always on his side. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 그리고 내가 동생이랑 싸우면, 우리 엄마께서는 항상 동생 편이셔. TIMES CORE
examples.english: And when I have a fight with my younger brother, my mom is always on his side. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: Your little brother[sister] isn't someone you fight with. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 동생하고 싸우면 못쓴다 Neungyule
examples.english: Your little brother[sister] isn't someone you fight with. Add to Wordbook
